name: Ghana
takeaway: Ghana has a longstanding bilateral relationship with the PRC, and the PRC's influence can be seen in several of the Domains.

The government of Ghana is careful to not offend and destroy its relationship the PRC. This can be seen by its failure to prosecute some PRC citizens involved in serious crimes such as illegal mining and unlawful exportation of natural resources.

The PRC is able to influence media reportage of the PRC by strategically providing all-expenses paid trip to journalists from key media organisations in Ghana to visit China in exchange for positive publicity and access to a page or two in domestic newspapers.
Donations and aid from PRC-connected individuals and entities to Ghana appears to be one of the main strategies that allows the PRC to have influence over the Republic of Ghana.
description-1: In 2023, Ghana had a GDP per capita of US$2,238 and a total population of 33.47 million people.
description-2: Ghana established diplomatic relations with the PRC in 1960. Ghana was ranked 50/180 in Reporters without Border’s 2024 World Press Freedom index and ranked Free in Freedom Status in Freedom House’s 2024 Global Freedom Status with a score of 80/100.
